NniPatchParameters.title: Network to network interconnect patch parameters

networkToNetworkInterconnect.description: Configuration used to setup CE-PE connectivity.

layer3Configuration.description: Multi Protocol Border Gateway Protocol configuration. This BGP configuration enables exchange of routes using mp-BGP for multiple isolation domains with single peering.

terminalServerConfiguration.description: Network and credentials configuration already applied to terminal server.

MpBgpPatchableProperties.title: Multi Protocol Border Gateway Protocol configuration updatable properties

routerId.description: Router Id of CE to be used for MP-BGP between PE and CE

peerAsn.description: ASN of PE devices for CE/PE connectivity.Example : 28

TerminalServerPatchableProperties.description: Network and credential configuration currently applied on terminal server.

networkDeviceId.description: ARM Resource ID used for the NetworkDevice.

username.description: Username for the terminal server connection.

password.description: Password for the terminal server connection.

racks.description: List of NetworkRack resource IDs under the Network Fabric. The number of racks allowed depends on the Network Fabric SKU.

l2IsolationDomains.description: List of L2IsolationDomain resource IDs under the Network Fabric.

l3IsolationDomains.description: List of L3IsolationDomain resource IDs under the Network Fabric.

allOf.description: Common patchable properties for Network Fabric.

networkFabricSku.description: Supported Network Fabric SKU.Example: Compute / Aggregate racks. Once the user chooses a particular SKU, only supported racks can be added to the Network Fabric. The SKU determines whether it is a single / multi rack Network Fabric.

networkFabricControllerId.description: Azure resource ID for the NetworkFabricController the NetworkFabric belongs.

networkToNetworkInterconnect.description: Configuration used to setup CE-PE connectivity.

layer2Configuration.description: Layer2Configuration configuration. This BGP configuration enables exchange of routes using mp-BGP for multiple isolation domains with single peering.

portCount.description: Number of ports connected between PE/CE. Maximum value depends on FabricSKU.

mtu.description: MTU of the packets between PE & CE.

interfaces.description: List of network device interfaces resource IDs.

items.description: Azure resource ID for the NetworkDevice/networkInterface.

layer3Configuration.description: Multi Protocol Border Gateway Protocol configuration. This BGP configuration enables exchange of routes using mp-BGP for multiple isolation domains with single peering.

fabricAsn.description: ASN of CE devices for CE/PE connectivity. Default value is 65001.

terminalServerConfiguration.description: Network and credentials configuration currently applied to terminal server.

managementNetworkConfiguration.description: Configuration to be used to setup the management network.

state.description: Indicates configuration state. Example: enabled | disabled.
Indicates configuration state. Example: enabled | disabled.

operationalState.description: Gets the operational state of the resource.

provisioningState.description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

ManagementVPNDesiredStates.description: Desired state for the Management VPN.

result.description: Result of the NetworkFabric configuration validation.

tags.description: Azure resource tags that will replace the existing ones.

nextLink.description: Url to follow for getting next page of resources.

mtu.description: MTU to use for option A peering.

OptionBProperties.description: Option B configuration to be used for management vpn.

importRouteTargets.description: Route Targets to be applied for incoming routes into CE.

exportRouteTargets.description: Route Targets to be applied for outgoing routes from CE.

EnableDisableNniLayer2Properties.description: List of network interface resource IDs.

items.description: Azure resource ID for the NetworkDevices/NetworkInterface.

EnableDisableNniLayer3Properties.description: List of Network Device resource IDs.

items.description: Azure resource ID for the NetworkDevices.

NniStatusProperties.description: Nni Layer2 and Layer3 status properties

Layer3IpPrefixProperties.description: Layer 3 primary and secondary ip address prefixes.

primaryIpv4Prefix.description: IPv4 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 172.31.0.0/31. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

primaryIpv6Prefix.description: IPv6 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 3FFE:FFFF:0:CD30::a0/126. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

secondaryIpv4Prefix.description: Secondary IPv4 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 172.31.0.20/31. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

secondaryIpv6Prefix.description: Secondary IPv6 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 3FFE:FFFF:0:CD30::a4/126. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.
